<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Definitions.
</B>
	The following terms when capitalized have the following meaning:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Affiliate -
</B>
	Any person, any corporation, association, partnership, joint venture or other business entity of which 50% or more of the voting stock or other equity interests (in the case of entities other than
	corporations), is owned or controlled (directly or indirectly) by the Company or by one or more of its Affiliates, or by a combination thereof.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Annual Base Pay
</B>
	- The annual base salary of an Eligible Employee at the time of the Eligible Employee&#146;s Termination of Employment, excluding management incentive compensation, overtime, or any other
	additions to salary.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Base Pay -
</B>
	The Annual Base Pay of an Eligible Employee divided by 52. Base Pay shall not include management incentive compensation, overtime or any other additions to salary.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(d)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Basic Severance Benefit -
</B>
	The benefit payable under Section&nbsp;5(a) of the Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(e)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Cause
</B>
	- Any of the following: (i)&nbsp;Commission of a crime that the Company determines could harm the Company&#146;s reputation or financial prospects or could subject the Company to penalties or sanctions;
	(ii)&nbsp;A violation of any of the Company&#146;s corporate policy statements that involve compliance with law which violation the Company determines could harm the Company&#146;s reputation or financial prospects; (iii)&nbsp;A violation of the
	Company&#146;s Code of Ethics and Business Conduct that the Company determines could harm the Company&#146;s reputation or financial prospects; (iv)&nbsp;Refusal to cooperate with the Company in a Company investigation; or (v)&nbsp;Any similar
	conduct with respect to which the Company determines in its sole discretion that the payment of a benefit under the Plan would not be in the Company&#146;s best interest.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage247"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Claims Administrator
</B>
	&#045; The Committee, in the case of an Officer, and the Savings Plan Administrative Committee, in the case of any other Employee.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>

	Committee
</B>
	&#045; The Management Development and Compensation Committee of the Company&#146;s Board of Directors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<B>
	(h)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Company -
</B>
	Lockheed Martin Corporation. For the purposes of the Plan, the term &#147;Company&#148; shall include any successor entity (by merger or otherwise).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(i)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Eligible Employee -
</B>
	An Employee who satisfies the requirements for eligibility for coverage under Section&nbsp;3 and who is not covered by any of the exceptions described in Section&nbsp;4.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(j)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Employee
</B>
	&#045; An individual who is employed by the Company and is treated on the Company&#146;s payroll records as a salaried employee of the Company. The term &#147;Employee&#148; includes an Officer but does
	not include anyone who is not a citizen or resident of the United States and whose duties are primarily performed outside the United States.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(k)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Executive Layoff Event
</B>
	&#045; Termination of Employment of an Eligible Employee that is (i)&nbsp;initiated by the Company (including under a separation window program offered by the Company that incorporates the
	terms of this Plan or a portion thereof and that meets the applicable exception from Code section&nbsp;409A and the accompanying Treasury Regulations ) for reasons other than for Cause; and (ii)&nbsp;designated by the Board of Directors in the case
	of an Officer, or the Senior Vice President, Human Resources or his or her delegate in the case of any Eligible Employee other than an Officer, as an Executive Layoff Event. An Executive Layoff Event does not include a termination that is described
	in Section&nbsp;4.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(l)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Follow-on Benefits
</B>
	&#045; A payment equal to the cost to the Eligible Employee of continuing for one year his or her coverage under the Company&#146;s medical, dental and vision plans under the plans and with the
	same level of coverage as elected by the Eligible Employee during open enrollment for the Plan Year in which the Executive Layoff Event occurs (but excluding flexible spending account plans). The amount will be equal to the cost charged Employees
	for coverage provided by the Company pursuant to the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1987 (COBRA coverage).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(m)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Full Bonus Equivalent
</B>
	- An amount equal to an Eligible Employee&#146;s Annual Base Pay multiplied by the target level assigned to the Eligible Employee under Paragraph B of Exhibit A to the Lockheed Martin
	Corporation 2006 Management Incentive Compensation Plan (Performance-Based) or any successor plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</B>
</TD>

	Officer
</B>
	&#045; An Employee who is elected as an officer of the Company by the Board of Directors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

</B>

</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<B>
	(q)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<B>
	Prorated Bonus Equivalent
</B>
	&#045; With respect to an Eligible Employee who is a participant in the Lockheed
	Martin Corporation 2006 Management Incentive
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	2
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage248"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Compensation Plan (2006)&nbsp;(or any successor plan), the Attorney Incentive Plan, or the Lockheed Martin Corporation Cyber Compensation Plan, or, with respect to Eligible Employees who are not
	Officers, other annual incentive plan that is designated by the Senior Vice President, Human Resources in his or her sole discretion, an amount equal to (i)&nbsp;an Eligible Employee&#146;s Base Pay multiplied by the target percentage assigned to
	the Eligible Employee under the applicable annual incentive plan, or, with respect to an Eligible Employee who is a participant in the Lockheed Martin Corporation Employee Incentive Plan, or, with respect to Eligible Employees who are not Officers,
	other annual incentive plan that is designated by the Senior Vice President, Human Resources in his or her sole discretion, an amount equal to (ii)&nbsp;an Eligible Employee&#146;s Base Pay multiplied by the percentage assigned to the
	&#147;achieved&#148; payout under the applicable annual incentive plan and (iii)&nbsp;then multiplying the product obtained under (i)&nbsp;or (ii), as applicable, by the number of weeks in the Plan Year in which the Executive Layoff Event occurs for
	which the Eligible Employee was paid by the Company for at least one day. For the purposes of this Section&nbsp;1(q), no week may be counted twice. For the avoidance of doubt, (I)&nbsp;no Eligible Employee who, at the time of the Executive Layoff
	Event, works for Lockheed Martin Investment Management Company and is a participant in any Lockheed Martin Investment Management Company investment incentive plan will receive a Prorated Bonus Equivalent under the Plan; rather, any bonus payable
	under any such investment incentive plan will be governed by the terms of that investment incentive plan; and (II) no Eligible Employee who receives a Pro Rata Bonus Equivalent under the Plan will be eligible to receive any payment under the
	applicable annual incentive plan for the year in which the Executive Layoff Event occurs.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(r)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Salaried Employee Plan -
</B>
	The Severance Benefit Plan for Eligible Salaried Employees of Lockheed Martin Corporation or any successor plan that provides benefits in the case of a layoff or reduction in force to
	salaried employees of the Company or its Affiliates.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>

<B>
	(t)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Severance Benefit -
</B>
	Benefits payable under the Plan which could be a Basic Severance Benefit or a Supplemental Severance Benefit.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<B>
	(u)
</B>
</TD>

<B>
	Supplemental Severance Benefit -
</B>
	The benefit payable under Section&nbsp;5(b) of the Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(v)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Termination of Employment -
</B>
	A separation from service as such term is defined in Code section 409A and the regulations thereunder.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(w)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Years of Service -
</B>
	The number of consecutive calendar months from (and including) the month of the Eligible Employee&#146;s date of hire through and including the month in which the applicable Employee&#146;s
	Executive Layoff Event occurs, divided by 12, subject to the following:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Service Limited to Whole Years
</U>
	. Fractional Years of Service will be disregarded, so that only full Years of Service will be recognized. The only exception relating to fractional years of service pertains to
	Eligible Employees who have more than six months of service, but less than a full year of service, in which case the Years of Service will be calculated as one year;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Certain Periods of Leave
</U>
	. Time periods of leave during the Employee&#146;s employment that do not or would not qualify for credited service under the pension plan applicable to the Eligible Employee will be
	deducted from the total period of employment to calculate the Eligible Employee&#146;s Years of Service;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	3
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage249"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	An Eligible Employee&#146;s Years of Service under the foregoing rules shall never exceed the actual number of full years worked by the Employee for the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Effective Date.
</B>
	The Plan shall be effective with respect to Executive Layoff Events that occur and are announced on or after January&nbsp;1, 2008. Amendments to the Plan are effective as of the dates set forth
	above.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Eligibility for Coverage.
</B>
	An Employee shall be eligible for coverage under the Plan if the Employee satisfies all of the following:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	At the time of the Executive Layoff Event, the Employee is either:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	an Officer;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	a Level 7 or Level 8 Employee;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	any other Employee (other than an Employee described in (i)&nbsp;or (ii)&nbsp;of this Section&nbsp;3(a)) who is designated in writing by the Senior Vice President, Human Resources or his or her delegate as eligible to
	participate in the Plan, provided that such Employee was an Employee described in (i)&nbsp;or (ii)&nbsp;of this Section&nbsp;3(a) within the 6-month period prior to the date that the Employee is designated as eligible for the Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Employee has not waived coverage under the Plan;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Employee is not receiving a benefit under the Salaried Employee Plan and is not a party to another plan, agreement or arrangement providing severance or similar benefits on account of termination of employment;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Employee is not disqualified for a Severance Benefit because the Employee&#146;s Termination of Employment is on account of one of the exceptions set forth in Section&nbsp;4; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(e)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Senior Vice President, Human Resources or his or her delegate determines in his or her sole discretion that the Employee&#146;s employment has terminated or will terminate on account of Executive Layoff Event
	(including acceptance of a separation window program offered by the Company that incorporates this Plan or a portion thereof by reference). In the case of an Officer, this determination will be made by the Committee in its sole discretion.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	4.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Exceptions To Coverage As An Executive Layoff Event.
</B>
	Notwithstanding Section&nbsp;3 or anything else to the contrary, an Employee&#146;s Executive Layoff Event will not be considered to have occurred and the
	Employee will not be entitled to a Severance Benefit if:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Employee is transferred to or assumes another position within the Company or with any Affiliate;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	4
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage250"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Employee is transferred to, assumes, or is offered a job or position with (A)&nbsp;a purchaser of stock of the Company, or of assets of the Company, or of a business unit(s) of the Company, or of stock or other
	equity interests or assets of an Affiliate(s) or of a business unit(s) of an Affiliate; (B)&nbsp;the surviving entity following a merger or consolidation of the Company or an Affiliate(s) with another entity; (C)&nbsp;an entity serving as a
	contractor or a succeeding contractor (including a subcontractor or outsourcer) for business or functions performed by the Company; (D)&nbsp;an entity including but not limited to a joint venture, limited liability company or partnership to whom
	control of a business unit, organization or function within the Company or a business unit of the Company or of an Affiliate, or contract is transferred, whether by a stock or asset sale or other means; or (E)&nbsp;an affiliate of any such
	purchaser, contractor, succeeding contractor, subcontractor, outsourcer or entity;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Employee is terminated for Cause; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Employee (i)&nbsp;terminates employment on his or her own initiative including retirement, resignation, failure to return from leave of absence or disability, or (ii)&nbsp;dies. If an Employee elects to retire
	concurrent with an Executive Layoff Event, then the Employee will not fall within this exception to coverage.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
</B>
	5.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Calculation of Severance Benefit.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Basic Severance Benefit Applicable to all Eligible Employees.
</U>
	The Basic Severance Benefit payable to an Eligible Employee shall equal two weeks of the Eligible Employee&#146;s Base Pay.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Supplemental Severance Benefit
</U>
	. The following Supplemental Severance Benefits are in addition to the Basic Severance Benefit and are available only to Eligible Employees who within 45 calendar days of the
	Eligible Employee&#146;s Termination of Employment as a result of an Executive Layoff Event execute (i)&nbsp;a valid and binding written release of the Company and its directors, officers and Employees of claims of any kind or nature in respect of
	the Employee&#146;s employment with the Company and any predecessor employer (and each of their affiliates) in the form supplied by the Company; and do not revoke any such release of claims within any revocation period provided for in the release of
	claims, and, (ii)&nbsp;except where prohibited under applicable law, a Post-Employment Conduct Agreement substantially in the form attached to the Plan as Exhibit&nbsp;A.1 (for Officers) or A.2 (for Eligible Employees who are not Officers) and as
	amended to reflect specific jurisdictional or other requirements.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	For the Chief Executive Officer &#150; a lump sum payment equal to the sum of 2.99 times Annual Base Pay plus 2.99 times Full Bonus Equivalent plus Follow-on Benefits.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	For an Officer other than the Chief Executive Officer &#150; a lump sum payment equal to the sum of Annual Base Pay plus Full Bonus Equivalent plus Follow-on Benefits.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	For an Eligible Employee under Section&nbsp;3(a)(ii) or (iii)&nbsp;who is not an Officer on the date of the Eligible Employee&#146;s Executive Layoff Event &#150; a lump sum payment equal to the sum of:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	5
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage251"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	15 weeks of the Eligible Employee&#146;s Base Pay; plus
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the product of the number of full Years of Service credited to the Eligible Employee multiplied by the Eligible Employee&#146;s weekly rate of Base Pay; provided that the sum of (a)&nbsp;and (b)&nbsp;of this
	Section&nbsp;5&nbsp;(b)(iii) may not exceed 39 weeks of the Eligible Employee&#146;s Base Pay; plus
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Eligible Employee&#146;s Pro Rata Bonus Equivalent, provided that in order to be eligible for payment of Pro Rata Bonus Equivalent, the Eligible Employee must be employed on a full time basis during the first
	calendar quarter of the Plan Year in which the Eligible Employee&#146;s Executive Layoff Event occurs with a termination date no earlier than April&nbsp;1 of such Plan Year; plus
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Follow-on Benefits.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iv)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In addition to the applicable amount specified in Section (b)&nbsp;(i), (ii), or (iii)&nbsp;above, an Eligible Employee who is receiving a Supplemental Severance Benefit also will be eligible to receive
	(a)&nbsp;outplacement services for one year (or, with respect to Eligible Employees who are not Officers, the cash value of the outplacement services as set forth in Section&nbsp;5(c)(iii)(a), if applicable); and (b)&nbsp;if the Eligible Employee
	relocated in order to fill the position held by the Eligible Employee at the time of the Executive Layoff Event, he or she will also be eligible for relocation services in accordance with CPS&nbsp;538 (or, with respect to Eligible Employees who are
	not Officers and who relocated pursuant to CPS&nbsp;538 within 60&nbsp;months prior to their Executive Layoff Event, the cash payment set forth in Section&nbsp;5(c)(iii)(b), if applicable).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Timing of Payment of Severance Benefit
</U>
	&#150; The amount of the Severance Benefit payable under Section&nbsp;5(a) and Section&nbsp;5&nbsp;(b)(i), (ii)&nbsp;or (iii)&nbsp;above will be paid in a lump sum, less
	applicable tax withholdings as follows:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In the case of payment of a Basic Severance Benefit, within 90&nbsp;days following the Eligible Employee&#146;s Executive Layoff Event, but in no event later than the March&nbsp;15 immediately following the year in
	which the Eligible Employee&#146;s Executive Layoff Event; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	In the case of payment of a Supplemental Severance Benefit, within 90 days following the Eligible Employee&#146;s
	(a)&nbsp;Executive Layoff Event, and (b)&nbsp;execution of a release of claims and the expiration of any applicable revocation period thereunder following such Executive Layoff Event, but in no event later than the March&nbsp;15 immediately
	following the year in which the Eligible Employee&#146;s Executive Layoff Event occurs. Outplacement and relocation expenses paid as part of the Supplemental Severance Benefit will be provided by a third party provider selected by the Company.
	Outplacement or relocation expenses will be paid by the
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	6
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage252"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Company to the third party providing the services following billing to the Company and must be incurred no later than December&nbsp;31 of the second year following the year in which the Eligible
	Employee&#146;s Executive Layoff Event occurred and paid by the Company no later than December&nbsp;31 of the third year following the year in which the Eligible Employee&#146;s termination of employment occurred. To the extent that
	(i)&nbsp;Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;409A applies to any payment under this Plan, and (ii)&nbsp;the employee is required to sign a release of claims or noncompetition agreement in order to receive payment, payments under this Plan shall be
	made no later than 90 days following the Executive Layoff Event; provided that if the payment period or the period in which the employee may consider whether to sign the release or other agreement spans two taxable years, payment shall be made or
	shall commence in the later taxable year.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Notwithstanding the foregoing:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	an Eligible Employee other than an Officer may elect to receive (in lieu of outplacement services) a cash payment equal to $10,000 for Level 7 Employees and $15,000 for Level 8 Employees.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	an Eligible Employee who is not an Officer and who relocated pursuant to CPS 538 within 60 months prior to his or her Executive Layoff Event may elect to receive (in lieu of relocation services) a cash payment in the
	amount of $75,000.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The cash payments described in Section&nbsp;5(c)(iii) will be paid (less applicable tax withholdings) on the same terms and conditions as the Supplemental Severance Benefit within 90 days following the Eligible
	Employee&#146;s (a)&nbsp;Executive Layoff Event, and (b)&nbsp;execution of a release of claims and the expiration of any applicable revocation period thereunder following such Executive Layoff Event, but in no event later than the March&nbsp;15
	immediately following the year in which the Eligible Employee&#146;s Executive Layoff Event occurs; provided that, to the extent that a payment is subject to Code section 409A, if the payment period or the period during which the employee may
	consider whether to execute the release spans two taxable years, the payment shall be made in the later taxable year. The elections described in this Section&nbsp;5(c)(iii) shall be made at such time and in such manner as determined by the Company
	in its sole discretion. If no such election is made, the Eligible Employee shall remain eligible for outplacement and relocation services as set forth in Section&nbsp;5(c)(ii), and the amounts paid by the Company for such services shall be reported
	as taxable income to the Eligible Employee.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Maximum Benefit Payable
</U>
	&#150; Notwithstanding anything in the Plan to the contrary, if the total amount of benefits, including Plan benefits, provided to an Eligible Employee would result in an &#147;excess
	parachute payment&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;280G of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended
<B>
	,
</B>
	the Company, in its sole discretion, may reduce the benefits provided under the Plan so that the total payment will not result
	in an excess parachute payment to the Eligible Employee.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	7
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage253"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(e)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Specified Employees
</U>
	&#150; The benefits under this Plan are intended to meet the exceptions under Code section&nbsp;409A for short term deferrals, involuntary severance payments, and/or benefits payable within a
	limited time after separation from service. However, to the extent any benefit payable under this Plan to an Eligible Employee who is a &#147;specified employee&#148; (as defined in Code section&nbsp;409A) is subject to Code section&nbsp;409A, such
	benefit payment shall be delayed until 6 months following the month in which the Eligible Employee has a Termination of Employment from the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
</B>
	6.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Further Conditions on Payment of Severance Benefit.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company retains the right to condition payment of a Basic Severance Benefit or Supplemental Severance Benefit upon the Eligible Employee maintaining fully satisfactory work performance until the effective date of
	the Eligible Employee&#146;s Executive Layoff Event as agreed to by the Company, including the Eligible Employee&#146;s faithful performance of any remaining obligations the Eligible Employee may owe to the Company such as prompt reimbursement to
	the Company for cash advances and debit balances and the return of all Company property. To the extent the Eligible Employee fails to maintain fully satisfactory work performance until the effective date of the Eligible Employee&#146;s Executive
	Layoff Event, such Eligible Employee shall forfeit his or her Basic Severance Benefit and/or Supplemental Severance Benefit, in their entirety, to the extent of any such benefit.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In the event an Eligible Employee who is entitled to a Supplemental Severance Benefit becomes employed by the Company (or an Affiliate) prior to the first anniversary of his or her Executive Layoff Event, the Eligible
	Employee shall be obligated to repay to the Company an amount equal to the amount of the Employee&#146;s Supplemental Severance Benefit multiplied by a fraction, the numerator of which is the number of weeks (capped at 52) in the one-year period
	following the Employee&#146;s termination of employment during which the Employee is employed by the Company and the denominator of which is fifty-two (52).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If an Eligible Employee dies after his or her Termination of Employment, but before payment of a Basic Severance Benefit is made, the Basic Severance Benefit will be paid to his or her estate. If an Eligible Employee
	dies after he or she has signed the release of claims and the release of claims is delivered to the Company within the time limit provided in Section&nbsp;5(b) of the Plan, then the Supplemental Severance Benefit will be paid to his or her estate in
	accordance with the timing rules in Section&nbsp;5(d).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The benefits under the Plan are in lieu of, and not in addition to, any other severance or similar benefits for which the Eligible Employee may be eligible under any Company plan, policy, agreement or arrangement
	(including but not limited to the Salaried Employee Plan). As a condition to receiving a benefit under the Plan, the Company may require that the Eligible Employee waive rights under all other plans, policies, agreements or arrangements providing
	severance or similar benefits or may reduce the amount payable under the Plan by the amount payable under any other such plan policy, agreement or arrangement. In no event shall the Company&#146;s administration of the Plan in accordance with the
	preceding sentence operate to delay payment of a benefit under the Plan to an Eligible Employee beyond March&nbsp;15
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	immediately following the year in which such Eligible Employee&#146;s
	Executive Layoff Event occurs.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	8
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage254"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	7.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Administration.
</B>
	The Company may appoint or employ such persons as it deems necessary to render advice with respect to any responsibility of the Company under the Plan. The Committee, with respect to Officers, and
	the Savings Plan Administrative Committee, with respect to all other Employees shall determine the eligibility of any Employee to participate in the Plan and the right of any Employee to any benefit and the amount of any benefit payable under the
	Plan to any individual. The Committee and the Savings Plan Administrative Committee shall have the discretionary authority to interpret any term of the Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
</B>
	8.
<B>
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Claims Procedure.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Senior Vice President, Human Resources or his or her delegate shall notify each Eligible Employee who has been determined to have incurred an Executive Layoff Event and who is eligible to receive benefits under the
	Plan and shall provide any forms required in connection with application for such benefits. If any Employee disagrees with determination of his or her benefits, the Employee may submit a written statement to the Claims Administrator describing the
	basis of the claim for benefits, together with any forms required in connection with application for a benefit, at any time within the 120 day period following the date on which the Employee claims to have become entitled to the Basic Severance
	Benefits or the Supplemental Severance Benefits.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The procedures when a claim under the Plan is wholly or partially denied are as follows:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Claims Administrator shall, within 90 days after receipt of a claim, furnish to claimant a written notice setting forth, in a manner calculated to be understood by claimant: (1)&nbsp;the specific reason or reasons
	for the denial; (2)&nbsp;specific reference to pertinent Plan provisions on which the denial is based; (3)&nbsp;a description of any additional materials or information necessary for the claimant to perfect the claim and an explanation of why such
	material or information is necessary; (4)&nbsp;an explanation of the steps to be taken if the claimant wishes to have the denial reviewed; and (5)&nbsp;a statement of the claimant&#146;s right to bring a civil action under section 502(a) of ERISA
	following an adverse determination on review. The 90 day period may be extended for not more than an additional 90 days if special circumstances make such an extension necessary. The Claims Administrator shall give the claimant, before the end of
	the initial 90 day period, a written notice of such extension, stating such special circumstances and the date by which the Claims Administrator expects to render a decision.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	By a written application filed with the Claims Administrator within 60 days after receipt by claimant of the written notice described in paragraph (a), the claimant or his or her duly authorized representative may
	request review of the denial of his or her claim by the Claims Administrator.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	In connection with review by the Claims Administrator, the claimant or his duly authorized representative may
	submit issues, comments, documents, records and other information relating to the claim for benefits under the Plan to the Claims Administrator. In addition, the claimant will be provided, upon request and free of charge, reasonable access to and
	copies of all documents, records, or other information &#147;relevant&#148; to claimant&#146;s claim for benefits. A document, record, or other information is &#147;relevant&#148; if it: (1)&nbsp;was relied upon in making the benefit determination;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	9
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage255"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	(2)&nbsp;was submitted, considered or generated in the course of making the benefit determination, without regard to whether such document, record or information was relied upon in making the
	benefit determination; or (3)&nbsp;demonstrates compliance with administrative processes and safeguards required under federal law.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iv)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Claims Administrator will provide an impartial review that takes into account all comments, records and other information submitted by the claimant relating to the claim, without regard to whether such information
	was submitted or considered in the initial benefit determination. The Claims Administrator shall make a decision and furnish such decision in writing to the claimant within 60 days after receipt by the Claims Administrator of the request for review.
	This period may be extended by the Claims Administrator to not more than 120 days after such receipt if special circumstances make such an extension necessary. The claimant will be notified in writing prior to the expiration of the original 60-day
	period if such an extension is required, and such notice will include the reason for the extension and the date by which it is expected that a decision will be reached. The decision on review shall be in writing, set forth in a manner calculated to
	be understood by the claimant and shall include: (1)&nbsp;the specific reasons for the decision; (2)&nbsp;specific reference to the pertinent Plan provisions on which the decision is based; (3)&nbsp;a statement that the claimant is entitled to
	receive, upon request and free of charge, reasonable access to and copies of all documents, records, and other information &#147;relevant&#148; to the claimant&#146;s claim for benefits; (4)&nbsp;a description of any additional material or
	information necessary for the claimant to perfect the claim and an explanation of why such material or information is necessary; (5)&nbsp;a statement describing any voluntary appeal procedures and the claimant&#146;s right to obtain information
	about such procedures, if any; and (6)&nbsp;a statement of the claimant&#146;s right to bring a civil action under section 502(a) of ERISA following an adverse benefit determination on review. In the event that the Claims Administrator must make a
	determination of disability in order to decide a claim, the Claims Administrator shall follow the special claims procedures for disability benefits described in Department of Labor Regulation section 2560.503-1(d). The Claims Administrator shall
	render a decision within a reasonable time (not to exceed 90 days) after the claimant&#146;s request for review, rather than within 120 days as set forth in the above paragraph.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(v)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In filing a claim or appeal under this Section&nbsp;8, an Employee at his or her option may act through an authorized representative.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	9.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Funding
</B>
	. The Plan shall not be funded through a trust, insurance contract or otherwise, and all benefit payments from the Plan shall be made from the general assets of the Company. Accordingly, an Employee shall
	not have any claim against specific assets of the Company, and shall be only a general creditor, with respect to any rights he/she may have under the Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	10.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Amendment and Termination of Plan
</B>
	. The Plan may be amended, in whole or in part, at any time by action of the Committee or by any authorized delegate, without notice, except that any amendment that would change
	the eligibility requirements or the amount of benefits payable under the Plan must be approved by the Committee. The Plan may be terminated by action of the Committee at any time. Upon termination of the Plan, the Company shall have no further
	liability hereunder, and all Plan benefits (including any amounts payable to Employees who separated from service before the date of Plan termination) shall cease.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	10
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage256"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	11.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	No Assignment.
</B>
	No Basic Severance Benefit or Supplemental Severance Benefit payable under the Plan may be assigned, transferred, pledged as a security for indebtedness or otherwise encumbered, or subjected to any
	legal process for the payment of any claim against an Employee.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	12.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Relationship to Other Benefits.
</B>
	An Employee&#146;s Basic Severance Benefit or Supplemental Severance Benefit shall not be taken into account to increase any benefits provided (or to continue coverage) under any
	other plan, policy, or arrangement of the Company or any Affiliate, except as otherwise expressly provided in writing in the other plan, policy, or arrangement, including accelerating vesting or other rights under the Lockheed Martin Corporation
	Amended and Restated Incentive Performance Award Plan (or any successor plan).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	13.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Governing Law.
</B>
	Except to the extent preempted by Federal law, the Plan shall be construed, administered and enforced according to the laws of the State of Maryland, without regard to its conflict of laws
	provisions. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, payments under this Award Agreement shall be made at a time and in a manner that satisfies the requirements of Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;409A.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Plan was approved by the Management Development and Compensation Committee and was originally effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2008.
	Amendments to the Plan are effective as of the date(s) set forth above.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
